title: Character variety
summary: In the mathematics of moduli theory, given an algebraic, reductive, Lie group G {\displaystyle G} and a finitely generated group π {\displaystyle \pi } , the G {\displaystyle G} -character variety of π {\displaystyle \pi } is a space of equivalence classes of group homomorphisms from π {\displaystyle \pi } to G {\displaystyle G} :
